requirement.title: General approach
requirement.description: An end user is be able to perform a transformation in 3 basic steps: choice of the source file together with the format it conforms to, selection of the destination folder and selection of the desired output format.

requirement.title: Easy integration
requirement.description: The framework is easy to integrate in existing solutions and does not assume the integration with a specific programming language or a specific OS.

requirement.title: Loose coupling
requirement.description: The different tasks that are solved by the framework are only loosely coupled and it is be possible to execute them without depending on other modules.

requirement.title: Parameter control
requirement.description: To customize the framework the user has the possibility to pre-set parameters in configuration files (in favour to make changes in the source code).

requirement.title: Helpful error-handling
requirement.description: If the user makes an error (e.g. by providing wrong input parameters or assuming features that are not implemented) the system returns error messages that help the user to be more successful the next time.

requirement.title: Test availability
requirement.description: Every implemented feature comes with a test.

requirement.title: User interface
requirement.description: There is a graphical user interface to use the framework.

requirement.title: Transformation orchestration
requirement.description: There is an option to orchestrate the different transformation steps through a configuration.

requirement.title: Orchestration independence
requirement.description: The framework does not depend on the orchestration approach.

requirement.title: Automatic validation
requirement.description: Every Output Format has the option to be validated automatically.

requirement.title: EBU-TT-D-Basic-DE to STL XML
requirement.description: There is an option to transform an EBU-TT-D-Basic-DE file in an STL XML file.

requirement.title: Code comments
requirement.description: Every relevant part of code is properly commented.

requirement.title: STL XML identity
requirement.description: When an STL XML file was converted to an EBU-TT file and the created EBU-TT file is converted back to STL XML, the resulting STL XML is semantically identical to the original STL XML file. If this is for some reason not possible it is documented and justified.

requirement.title: Error location
requirement.description: In an orchestrated configuration, occurring errors specifically point to the sub step the error occurred in or to the corresponding sub steps, if the error occurred in between.

requirement.title: Proper naming of tests
requirement.description: Every test provided in order to test a feature is properly named according to its designated use.

requirement.title: Single functionality testing
requirement.description: Every test provided in order to test a feature is only testing one specific feature in order to exclude collisions in testing procedures.

requirement.title: Complete documentation
requirement.description: The usage of the framework and the possibilities regarding the different ways to configure the single steps is completely documented.

requirement.title: 1:n transformation
requirement.description: An end user is able to start a single transformation that transforms a single input file in a set of different output formats. This set of output formats can be selected by the user.

requirement.title: STL XML to WEBVTT
requirement.description: There is an option to transform an STL XML file into a WEBVTT file.

requirement.title: EBU-TT to WEBVTT
requirement.description: There is an option to transform an EBU-TT Part 1 file into a WEBVTT file.

requirement.title: EBU-TT-D-Basic-DE to WEBVTT
requirement.description: There is be an option to transform an EBU-TT-D-Basic-DE file in a WEBVTT file.

requirement.title: WEBVTT to STL XML
requirement.description: There is an option to transform a WEBVTT file in an STL XML file.

requirement.title: WEBVTT to EBU-TT-D-Basic-DE
requirement.description: There is an option to transform a WEBVTT file in an EBU-TT-D-Basic-DE file.

requirement.title: Following EBU-TT Tech 3360
requirement.description: The user is able to transform an STL XML file in an EBU-TT Part 1 file and the transformation follows the guideline EBU-TT Tech 3360v0.9. If a different approach than documented in 3360 has been chosen, it is documented and justified.

requirement.title: Fields not mapped
requirement.description: The following GSI fields are not mapped from STL XML to EBU-TT: Total Number of TTI Blocks (TNB), Disk Sequence Number (DSN), Total Number of Disks (TND), Total Number of Subtitle Groups (TNG), Time Code: Status (TCS), Maximum Number of Displayable Rows (MNR) and Time Code: First in-cue (TCF).

requirement.title: Frame rate mapping
requirement.description: The ttp:frameRate attribute of the EBU-TT file's tt:tt element is set to "25" if the Disk Format Code (DFC) is "STL25.01" and to "30" if the DFC is "STL30.01". The ttp:frameRateMultiplier attribute is set to "1 1" if the DFC is "STL25.01" and to "1000 1001" if the DFC is "30". If the DFC element is not "STL25.01" or "STL30.01" (trailing and leading space removed), the processing of the input document terminates.

requirement.title: Partially Language Code mapping
requirement.description: The STL XML file's Language Code (LC) for German, Spanish, French, Italian, Portuguese and English is mapped to the xml:lang attribute of the EBU-TT file's tt:tt element according to the Language Code mapping in Annex C of EBU Tech 3360 version 0.9 (page 53). Other values of the Language Code (LC) are mapped to the empty string

requirement.title: Partially Country of Origin mapping
requirement.description: The STL XML file's Country of Origin (CO) for Germany, Spain, France, Italy, Portugal and England are mapped to the ebuttm:documentCountryOfOrigin element according to the Country of Origin Code mapping in Annex D of EBU Tech 3360 version 0.9 (page 57). If the country code value of the CO element is not supported the value ebuttm:documentCountryOfOrigin will be set to "und" (undefined).

requirement.title: Time Code: Start-of-Programme mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code: Start-of-Programme (TCP) field is mapped to a string that conforms to the type ebuttd:smpteTimingType in EBU-TT 3350 Part 1 v. 1.0 (page 46) and is placed into an ebuttm:documentStartOfProgramme element. If the timecode in the TCP element is invalid the processing of the document stops.

requirement.title: User-Defined Area mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's User-Defined Area (UDA) is converted into a BASE64 encoded string and is placed into an ebuttm:documentUserDefinedArea element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.25). Trailing spaces are not converted.

requirement.title: Original Programme Title mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Original Programme Title (OPT) is placed into an ebuttm:documentOriginalProgrammeTitle element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.25). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Original Episode Title mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Original Episode Title (OET) is placed into an ebuttm:documentOriginalEpisodeTitle element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.25). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Translated Programme Title maping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Translated Programme Title (TPT) is placed into an ebuttm:documentTranslatedProgrammeTitle element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.25). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Translated Episode Title mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Translated Episode Title (TET) is placed into an ebuttm:documentTranslatedEpisodeTitle element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.25). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Translator's Name mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Translator's Name (TN) is placed into an ebuttm:documentTranslatorsName element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.25). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Translator's Contact Details mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Translator's Contact Details (TCD) is placed into an ebuttm:documentTranslatorsContactDetails element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Subtitle List Reference Code mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Subtitle List Reference Code (SLR) is placed into an ebuttm:documentSubtitleListReferenceCode element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Publisher mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Publisher (PUB) is placed into an ebuttm:documentPublisher element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Editor's Name mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Editor's Name (EN) is placed into an ebuttm:documentEditorsName element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: Editor's Contact Details mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Editor's Contact Details (ECD) is placed into an ebuttm:documentEditorsContactDetails element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26). Trailing spaces are removed.

requirement.title: EBU-TT Document Creation Date mapping
requirement.description: The EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentCreationDate element takes the date the EBU-TT file is created as its content according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: EBU-TT Document Revision Number mapping
requirement.description: The EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentRevisionNumber element is set to 0 because every transformation creates an original version according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: EBU-TT Document Revision Date mapping
requirement.description: The EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentRevisionDate element takes the date the EBU-TT file is created as its content according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: STL XML Creation Date mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Creation Date (CD) is converted into xs:date and placed into an ebuttExt:stlCreationDate element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: STL XML Revision Date mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Revision Date (RD) is converted into string that conforms to the type xs:date and placed into an ebuttExt:stlRevisionDate element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: STL XML Revision Number mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Revision Number (RN) is converted into a non-negative integer and placed into an ebuttExt:stlRevisionNumber element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: Maximum Number of Displayable Characters mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Maximum Number of Displayable Characters (MNC) is converted into a non-negative integer and placed into an ebuttm:documentMaximumNumberOfDisplayableCharacterInAnyRow element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: Total Number of Subtitles mapping
requirement.description: The content of the STL XML file's Total Number of Subtitles (TNS) is converted into a non-negative integer and placed into an ebuttm:documentTotalNumberOfSubtitles element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.26).

requirement.title: tt:style element mapping - defaultStyle
requirement.description: The tt:styling element in the EBU-TT file's head section contains at least one tt:style child element whose xml:id attribute has the value "defaultStyle". All values are set as in the example on EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.30). It contains an explicit value for all inheritable style attributes by EBU-TT according to EBU Tech 3360 4.1 (p. 28).

requirement.title: tt:style element mapping - defaultStyle tts:writingMode
requirement.description: If the STL XML file's Language Code (LC) references a language read from right to left, the defaultStyle in the EBU-TT file is fully defined and the tts:writingMode attributes of all tt:region elements have the value "rltb" (right to left, top to bottom) according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.30).

requirement.title: tt:layout element mapping
requirement.description: The EBU-TT file's head section contains a tt:layout element with at least one tt:region child according to section 3.1.3 in EBU Tech 3350 (p. 34). Each tt:p element references a tt:region element. All regions created are fully defined with all attribute values supported by EBU-TT.

requirement.title: tt:body element mapping
requirement.description: The EBU-TT file's tt:body element contains at least one tt:div element. All tt:div element reference the defaultStyle style definition using its style attribute.

requirement.title: Subtitle Group Number mapping
requirement.description: If different subtitles within the STL XML file contain matching Subtitle Group Numbers (SGN), they are placed together in a containing tt:div element as tt:p elements according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.31). A tt:div element includes all tt:p elements with a common SGN number. Every tt:div element holds an xml:id attribute that holds the SGN converted to a string, prefixed by "SGN", e.g. "SGN1", and references the defaultStyle using its style attribute.

requirement.title: Subtitle Number mapping
requirement.description: If multiple TTI blocks in the STL XML file have the same Subtitle Number (SN) and their Extension Block Number (EBN) is between 0 (00h) and 239 (EFh), the content of their Text Fields (TF) is put together in a single tt:p element with the order depending on their respective EBN.

requirement.title: Extension Block Number 254 handling
requirement.description: If a TTI block in the STL XML file has the Extension Block Number (EBN) 254 and there are other TTI blocks with the same Subtitle Number (SN), its content is considered as proprietary User Data according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.32). The TTI block's content is mapped to a element with the name stlUserData. This element is a child of tt:metadata of the tt:p element which is created from the TTI blocks with the respective Subtitle Number (SN element). The stlUserData element is in the namespace http://www.irt.de/scf (prefix: scf).

requirement.title: Extension Block Number 254 discarding
requirement.description: If a TTI block in the STL XML file has the Extension Block Number (EBN) 254 and there are no other TTI blocks with the same Subtitle Number (SN), this TTI block is discarded.

requirement.title: TimeBase parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter,e.g. named "timeBase", to specify if the resulting EBU-TT file is using either "media" or "smpte" as the value of its tt:tt element's ttp:timeBase attribute. Its default value is "smpte".

requirement.title: Time Code In mapping
requirement.description: The value of the TTI block's Time Code In (TCI) field contains an EBU/SMPTE time-and-control code value. It is always decoded and its value placed into the "begin" attribute of the tt:p element generated from the respective TTI block according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.32). The type of the begin attribute is either ebuttdt:smpteTimingType or ebuttdt:mediaTimingType according to EBU Tech 3350 (p.40). The "timeBase" parameter defines which type is applied. If the timecode value of the TCI element does not conform to the expected timecode format (i.e. smpte timecode of format hhmmssff (hh = hours, mm = minutes, ss = seconds, ff = frames)) the transformation exits with an error message.

requirement.title: Time Code Out mapping
requirement.description: The value of the TTI block's Time Code Out (TCO) field contains an EBU/SMPTE time-and-control code value. It is always decoded and its value placed into the "end" attribute of the tt:p element generated from the respective TTI block according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.32). The type of the begin attribute is either ebuttdt:smpteTimingType or ebuttdt:mediaTimingType according to EBU Tech 3350 (p.40). The "timeBase" parameter defines which type is applied. If the timecode value of the TCI element does not conform to the expected timecode format the transformation exits with an error message.

requirement.title: Cumulative Subtitles mapping
requirement.description: A group of associated cumulative subtitles is put together in one tt:p element. The begin attribute of this tt:p element is equal to the begin attribute of the first cumulative subtitle (CS is 01h), the end attribute is equal to the last cumulative subtitle's (CS is 03h) end attribute. The order of the cumulative subtitle's parts is mapped according to EBU Tech 3264 (p.11). As the current version of EBU Tech 3360 doesn't cover cumulative status according to EBU Tech 3360 4.4.3 Cumulative Status p.32, interrupt the transformation if a CS element has a value other than 00.

requirement.title: Justification Code 01h mapping
requirement.description: If the TTI block's Justification Code (JC) has a value of 01h, the tt:p element containing the subtitle references a style definition whose tts:textAlign attribute has the value "start" according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.33). Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.

requirement.title: Justification Code 02h mapping
requirement.description: If the TTI block's Justification Code (JC) has a value of 02h, the tt:p element containing the subtitle references a style definition whose tts:textAlign attribute has the value "center" according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.33). Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.

requirement.title: Justification Code 03h mapping
requirement.description: If the TTI block's Justification Code (JC) has a value of 03h, the tt:p element containing the subtitle references a style definition whose tts:textAlign attribute has the value "end" according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.33). Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.

requirement.title: Comment Flag mapping
requirement.description: If the TTI block's Comment Flag (CF) has a value of 01h, the TTI block's text field contains comments not intended for transmission. In this case the content of the TTI block's text field is placed in an ebuttEXT:comment element. This element is a child of a tt:metadata element which itself is the first child of the containing tt:p element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.35).

requirement.title: Text Field mapping
requirement.description: A Text Field (TF) in the STL XML file is converted in one or more tt:span elements within a single tt:p element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.40). The Control codes taken into account for this mapping are the following: AlphaBlack, AlphaRed, AlphaGreen, AlphaYellow, AlphaBlue, AlphaMagenta, AlphaCyan, StartBox, EndBox, DoubleHeight, BlackBackground, NewBackground.

requirement.title: tt:p element mapping - xml:id
requirement.description: The tt:p element's xml:id attribute's value is created by concatenating a prefix (for example 'sub') with the content of the TTI block's SN element. A SN element's value of 0486 for example results in a possible xml:id attribute with value 'sub0486'.

requirement.title: tt:p element mapping - text content
requirement.description: All text content inside a created tt:p element is contained within tt:span elements. These spans are not nested according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.40).

requirement.title: DoubleHeight mapping
requirement.description: If textual content is specified as DoubleHeight in the TF of the STL XML file, the text is placed in a tt:span element where the vertical extent of the applied font has the double height compared to the "normal" font specified in the defaultStyle.

requirement.title: Line break handling
requirement.description: Each logical row of text in the STL XML file's TF following an existing row in the same subtitle is preceded by a single tt:br element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.40).

requirement.title: Control Codes mapping - closed subtitles
requirement.description: Relevant Control Codes in the STL XML file's Text Field (TF) result in closing the current tt:span element and opening a new one within the tt:p element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.40). The new tt:span references an appropriate style definition that represents the intent of the control characters. The Control Codes that are taken into account for this mapping are: AlphaBlack, Alpha White, AlphaRed, AlphaGreen, AlphaYellow, AlphaBlue, AlphaMagenta, AlphaCyan, StartBox, EndBox, DoubleHeight, BlackBackground, NewBackground

requirement.title: Control Codes mapping - italic underline
requirement.description: Control Codes for italics and underline in the STL XML file's Text Field (TF) result in closing the current tt:span element and opening a new one within the tt:p element according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.40). The new tt:span references an appropriate style definition that represents the intent of the control characters.

requirement.title: Teletext subtitle mapping
requirement.description: For teletext subtitles (DSC has a value of either 1 or 2), the tt:span elements reference a style definition with a black background colour by default if no other style is specified according to EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.40).

requirement.title: Processing Control Codes mapping - closed subtitles
requirement.description: Processing relevant Control Codes for Teletext STL files with closed subtitles are mapped according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41). The Control Codes that are taken into account for this mapping are: AlphaBlack, AlphaWhite, AlphaRed, AlphaGreen, AlphaYellow, AlphaBlue, AlphaMagenta, AlphaCyan, StartBox, EndBox, DoubleHeight, BlackBackground, NewBackground.

requirement.title: Processing Control Codes mapping - open subtitles
requirement.description: Processing Control Codes for Teletext STL files with open subtitles are mapped according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41).

requirement.title: BlackBackground element mapping
requirement.description: If the mapping of a BlackBackground element is actually changing the style property of the current tt:span element, it is mapped by closing this tt:span element. A new tt:span is opened referencing a style with a black background and appropriate background colour according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41). If the mapping of the element wouldn't change the current style, the current tt:span is not closed and the BlackBackground element is only interpreted as a space.

requirement.title: NewBackground element mapping
requirement.description: If the mapping of the NewBackground element changes the background-color of the current tt:span element, proceed as follows: The NewBackground element is mapped by opening a new tt:span. This tt:span references a style with the appropriate background and foreground colour in combination with the semantics of preceding and following control codes according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41). The tt:span element's style attribute references a style whose tts:backgroundColor attribute is set to appropriately represent the colour that is represented by the element proceeding the NewBackground element. For example, if an AlphaGreen element is proceeding the NewBackground element, the tts:backgroundColor attribute of the style that's referenced by the tt:span element's style attribute is set to a colour representing the AlphaGreen colouring. If the result of this described mapping doesn't differ from the style that's referenced by the current tt:span element, the Newbackground element is solely mapped to a space.

requirement.title: AlphaBlack element mapping
requirement.description: If the mapping of the AlphaBlack element changes the foreground color or background color currently applied to the text enclosed by a tt:span element, proceed as follows: The AlphaBlack element is mapped to a tt:span element whose style attribute references a style whose tts:color or tts:backgroundColor is set to a colour that appropriately represents the AlphaBlack colouring. Whether the tts:color or the tts:backgroundColor is set to the new colour depends on whether a NewBackground element is preceeding the AlphaBlack element (see EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p.41). If the mapping of the AlphaBlack does not change the foreground colour or background colour currently applied to the text enclosed by a tt:span element, it is mapped to a space when the space is necessary to separate two words. Otherwise it is ignored.

requirement.title: Alphawhite element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaWhite element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: AlphaRed element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaRed element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: AlphaGreen element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaGreen element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: AlphaYellow element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaYellow element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: AlphaBlue element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaBlue element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: AlphaMagenta element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaMagenta element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: AlphaCyan element mapping
requirement.description: The mapping of the AlphaCyan element follows the same procedure as described in requirement-079 for the AlphaBlack element.

requirement.title: EndBox element mapping
requirement.description: The EndBox element is mapped as closing a tt:span if one has been opened earlier according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41).

requirement.title: StartBox element mapping
requirement.description: The StartBox element is mapped as closing a tt:span if one has been opened earlier. In addition a new tt:span is opened referencing a style with the appropriate background and foreground colour according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41). If the StartBox Element has no following sibling EndBox, StartBox or newline element that "closes" the box the mapping is undefined.

requirement.title: StartBox element mapping with missing "closing element"
requirement.description: A StartBox Element opens a new tt:span element even it has no following sibling EndBox, StartBox or newline element which normally would close the opened StartBox. This may be the case when for at the last StartBox in a TF field the EndBox is ommited.

requirement.title: NormalHeight element mapping
requirement.description: The NormalHeight element is mapped by starting a new tt:span referencing a styling that references textual representation in a single row whose height is depending on the used cell-resolution according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41).

requirement.title: DoubleHeight element mapping
requirement.description: The DoubleHeight element is mapped by starting a new tt:span referencing a styling that represents textual representation in 2 teletext rows whose heights are depending on the used cell-resolution according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41).

requirement.title: Referenced Colours
requirement.description: An EBU-TT file that was created by the STLXML2EBU-TT module only references colours appropriately representing the EBUSTL Control Codes AlphaBlack, AlphaRed, AlphaGreen, AlphaYellow, AlphaBlue, AlphaMagenta, AlphaCyan and AlphaWhite according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 41). These colors are the following named colors: "black" for AlphaBlack, "red" for AlphaRed, "lime" for AlphaGreen, "yellow" for AlphaYellow, "blue" for AlphaBlue, "magenta" for AlphaMagenta, "cyan" for AlphaCyan and "white" for AlphaWhite.

requirement.title: In-vision Control Code mapping
requirement.description: Processing Control Codes for Open (In-vision) STL files are matched according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (p. 42).

requirement.title: GSI Block mapping consistency
requirement.description: The mapping of elements from the STL XML file's GSI Block into EBU-TT is complete and consistent with the table given in EBU Tech 3360 Annex A (p. 45).

requirement.title: offsetInSeconds parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, f.e. called "offsetInSeconds", that describes if an offset shall be used for the time codes or not. The value of the parameter is either "0" if no offset shall be used, or the value of the desired offset in seconds. If the parameter has a value different than 0, this offset is subtracted from all begin and end attributes' values.

requirement.title: offsetInFrames Parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. named "offsetInFrames", to define the time-offset that's used for the TCI and TCO elements. The format should be hh:mm:ss:ff (hh = hours, mm = minutes, ss = seconds, ff = frames) and the default is 00:00:00:00.

requirement.title: offsetTCP Parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. named "offsetTCP", that is used to express that the TCP field timecode is the time-offset that's used for the TCI and TCO elements. To enable this offset, the parameter has to be set to 1; the default is 0.

requirement.title: ignoreManualOffsetForTCP Parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter named "ignoreManualOffsetForTCP" that is used to *not* subtract any specified manual offsets (seconds or frames) from the TCP element when it is converted. To enable this feature, the parameter has to be set to 1; the default is 0.

requirement.title: storeSTLSourceFile Parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter named "storeSTLSourceFile" that enables binary data tunnelling of the original STL source file according to clause 2.3 of EBU Tech 3360 v0.9. The resulting ebuttm:binaryData element is hereby embedded as a child of the tt:metadata child element of the tt:head element (an alternative location at file end can be requested using an additional parameter; see below). If the required StlSource element in the source STLXML file is not present, the conversion is aborted. To enable this feature, the parameter has to be set to 1; the default is 0.

requirement.title: storeSTLSourceFileAtEnd Parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter named "storeSTLSourceFileAtEnd" that affects the binary data tunnelling of the original STL source file according to clause 2.3 of EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 (if that tunnelling is not enabled, this parameter has no effect). It stores the resulting ebuttm:binaryData element as a child of a tt:metadata child element of a newly created tt:div element (which has no succeeding siblings), instead of as a descendant of the tt:head element (see above). Note that according to EBU Tech 3350 v1.0, a tt:div element shall have at least one tt:p child element. Therefore this alternative location is only compliant to v1.1 or later. To enable this feature, the parameter has to be set to 1; the default is 0.

requirement.title: Element locations
requirement.description: The location of elements resulting from the mapping of the STL XML file's GSI Header into EBU-TT is consistent with the table given in EBU Tech 3360 Annex A (p. 45).

requirement.title: EBU-TT to STL XML
requirement.description: There is the option to transform an EBU-TT Part 1 file that was created by transforming an STL XML file into an EBU-TT file following EBU Tech 3360 v0.9 back into an STL XML file.

requirement.title: Guideline conformity - not calculable
requirement.description: When an EBU-TT file is converted in an STL XML file, information that can not be calculated from the EBU-TT document will be inserted according to a documented guideline. One example is the information for the GSI field DSN (Disc Sequence Number).

requirement.title: Guideline conformity - not supported
requirement.description: When an EBU-TT file is converted in an STL XML file, the mapping of information that is not supported in EBU-STL follows a documented guideline (e.g. the mapping of color values that are not supported in STLXML).

requirement.title: Code Page 850 support
requirement.description: The EBU-TT to STLXML module supports the Code Page 850 for the GSI Header block.

requirement.title: Code Page Number mapping
requirement.description: The Code Page Number (CPN) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set to 850 by default. This behaviour can be overwritten by the parameter "CPN".

requirement.title: Disc Format Code mapping
requirement.description: The Disk Format Code (DFC) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set to "STL25.01" if the calculated frame rate is equal to 25. If no frame rate was specified, 25 is assumed. If another value is set, the transformation is aborted.

requirement.title: DSC parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "DSC", that defines if the resulting STL XML file is intended to be used for teletext or open subtitles. Its value is either '', indicating undefined, 0 for indicating open subtitling, 1 or 2, indicating level-1 and level-2 teletext. The default value for this parameter is 2 if it's not specifically given when the transformation is started.

requirement.title: Display Standard Code mapping
requirement.description: The Display Standard Code (DSC) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped depending on its intended use according to the table in EBU Tech 3264 (p.6). Its value is set depending on the value given for the DSC parameter.

requirement.title: CCT parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter "CCT", that defines Character Code Table used in the resulting STL XML file. According to EBU Tech 3264 (p.7) its value ranges from 00 to 04 (3030 hex to 3034 hex).

requirement.title: Character Code Table mapping
requirement.description: The Character Code Table (CCT) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set as the code table's number that is given by the CCT parameter. If the number of the used codepage isn't defined by the parameter and can not be calculated depending on the characters used in the file's tt:p elements, the transformation is aborted.

requirement.title: LC parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "LC", that defines the Language Code used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Language Code mapping
requirement.description: The Language Code (LC) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped from the LC parameter. If the parameter is not set, the LC element's value is mapped to the xml:lang attribute of the EBU-TT file's tt:tt element according to the table in EBU Tech 3360 v9.0 Annex C. If this attribute isn't set, the value 00 is written. The supported languages are: Englisch, French, German, Italian, Portugues, Spanish

requirement.title: OPT parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "OPT", that defines the Original Programme Title used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Original Programme Title mapping
requirement.description: The Original Programme Title (OPT) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the OPT parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentOriginalProgrammeTitle. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format has more then 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: OET parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "OET", that defines the Original Episode Title used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Original Episode Title mapping
requirement.description: The Original Episode Title (OET) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the OET parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentOriginalEpisodeTitle. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format has more then 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: TPT parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "TPT", that defines the Translated Programme Title used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Translated Programme Title mapping
requirement.description: The Translated Programme Title (TPT) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the TPT parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentTranslatedProgrammeTitle. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: TET parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "TET", that defines the Translated Episode Title used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Translated Episode Title mapping
requirement.description: The Translated Episode Title (TET) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the TET parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentTranslatedEpisodeTitle. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 character, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: TN parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "TN", that defines the Translator's Name used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Translator's Name mapping
requirement.description: The Translator's Name (TN) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the TN parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentTranslatorsName. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: TCD parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "TCD", that defines the Translator's Contact Details used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Translator's Contact Details mapping
requirement.description: The Translator's Contact Details (TCD) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the TCD parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentTranslatorsContactDetails. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: SLR parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "SLR", that defines the Subtitle List Reference Code used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Subtitle List Reference Code mapping
requirement.description: The Subtitle List Reference Code (SLR) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the SLR parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is mapped to the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentSubtitleListReferenceCode. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty element is written. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 16 characters, it gets cut at the 16 character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed by the mapping.

requirement.title: Creation Date mapping
requirement.description: The Creation Date (CD) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set as the current date following ISO Standard 8601 and the format is YYMMDD (YY = year, MM = month, DD = Day).

requirement.title: Revision Date mapping
requirement.description: The Revision Date (RD) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set as the current date following ISO Standard 8601 (i.e. YYMMDD).

requirement.title: Revision Number mapping
requirement.description: The Revision Number (RN) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set to " 0".

requirement.title: tt:p element mapping
requirement.description: If the content of a tt:p element converted to STL text format takes up more than 112 bytes of space, the tt:p needs to be subdivided so that no single part uses more than 112 bytes of space. The Total Number of TTI Blocks (TNB) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is equivalent to the number of tt:p elements in the EBU-TT file's tt:body element needing 112 bytes or less in STL text format plus the amount of sub parts needed to convert those tt:p that take up too much space.

requirement.title: Total Number of Subtitles mapping
requirement.description: The Total Number of Subtitles (TNS) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is equivalent to the number of TTI blocks having their Extension Block Number (EBN) set to 255 (FFh), as an EBN value of 255 (FFh) states the last TTI block of a Group and thus ending a subtitle.

requirement.title: Total Number of Subtitle Groups mapping
requirement.description: For an EBU-TT file created by the STLXML2EBU-TT module the Total Number of Subtitle Groups (TNG) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is equivalent to the number of tt:div element children of the EBU-TT file's tt:body element.

requirement.title: MNC parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "MNC", that defines the Maximum Number of Displayable Characters used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Maximum Number of Displayable Characters in any text row mapping
requirement.description: The Maximum Number of Displayable Characters in any text row (MNC) is set to 40. If the parameter MNC is set its value takes precedence unless the DSC is 1 or 2 and the specified value is greater than 40.

requirement.title: MNR parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "MNR", that defines the Maximum Number of Displayable Rows used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Maximum Number of Displayable Rows mapping
requirement.description: The Maximum Number of Displayable Rows (MNR) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is mapped to the MNR parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is set to 23 if the intended use is for teletext and thus has a DSC with value 1 or 2. Otherwise the empty element is written.

requirement.title: Time Code: Status mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code: Status (TCS) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is set to 1. A value of 0 is not possible since EBU-TT doesn't allow untimed content.

requirement.title: TCP parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "TCP", that defines the Time Code: Start-of-Programme used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Time Code: Start-of-Programme mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code: Start-of-Programme (TCP) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is taken from the TCS parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is taken from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentStartOfProgramme. The default value for the TCP is 00000000.

requirement.title: TCF parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "TCF", that defines the Time Code: First in-cue used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Time Code: First in-cue mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code: First in-cue (TCF) is taken from the TCF parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is taken from the value of the first TTI block's TCI element. This is the Time Code of the first in-cue of the subtitle list, thus the first tt:p element's begin time that's valid.

requirement.title: Total Number of Disks mapping
requirement.description: If the content of a tt:p element converted to STL text format takes up more than 112 bytes of space, the tt:p needs to be subdivided so that no single parts uses more than 112 bytes of space. The Total Number of Disks (TND) is calculated from the number of tt:p elements in the EBU-TT file needing 112 bytes or less in STL text format plus the amount of sub parts needed to convert those tt:p that take up too much space. A single Disk can store 11242 TTI blocks. So if the sum of tt:p elements and needed sub parts exceeds 11242, the TND is calculated accordingly.

requirement.title: Disk Sequence Number mapping
requirement.description: The Disk Sequence Number (DSN) is set to 1 if the number of TTI block needed to match the tt:p elements in the EBU-TT file does not exceed 11242. Otherwise, the file is split into multiple STL XML files and the DSN of the respective files is incremented by 1 for each additional STL XML file up to the Total Number of Disks (TND).

requirement.title: CO parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "CO", that defines the Country of Origin used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Country of Origin mapping
requirement.description: The Country of Origin (CO) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is taken from the CO parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is taken from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentCountryOfOrigin. If the element is not present in the source document, an empty CO element is generated. The country codes are mapped for the countries United Kingdom, Italy, Spain, France, Portugal and Germany.

requirement.title: PUB parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "PUB", that defines the Publisher used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Publisher mapping
requirement.description: The Publisher (PUB) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is taken from to the PUB parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is taken from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentPublisher. If the element is not present in the source document, the empty PUB element is generated. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaced are trimmed.

requirement.title: EN parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "EN", that defines the Editor's Name used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Editor's Name mapping
requirement.description: The Editor's Name (EN) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is taken from the EN parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is taken from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentEditorsName. If the element is not present in the source document, an empty EN element is generated. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.

requirement.title: ECD parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "ECD", that defines the Editor's Conact Details used in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Editor's Contact Details mapping
requirement.description: The Editor's Contact Details (ECD) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is taken from the ECD parameter. If the parameter is not set, the element's value is taken from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentEditorsContactDetails. If the element is not present in the source document, an empty ECD element is generated. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 32 characters, it gets cut at the 32nd character. Leading and trailing spaces are trimmed.

requirement.title: User-Defined Area mapping
requirement.description: The User-Defined Area (UDA) in the STL XML file's GSI Header is taken from the EBU-TT file's ebuttm:documentUserDefinedArea. If the element is not present in the source document, 576 bytes of spaces are used. If the string converted to the STL XML file's text format requires more than 576 bytes, it gets cut at the 576th byte. If the resulting last byte is a control code, it is replaced by a space.

requirement.title: tt:p to TTI mapping
requirement.description: For every tt:p element at least one new TTI element is created.

requirement.title: Subtitle Group Number mapping
requirement.description: The Subtitle Group Number (SGN) is a child of a TTI element. If the EBU-TT file was created from the STLXML2EBU-TT module, its value is calculated from the order of the tt:div parents of the currently processed tt:p element. For example, if the tt:div element is the first within the tt:body element, the value "0" is set for SGN.

requirement.title: Subtitle Number mapping
requirement.description: The Subtitle Number (SN) is a child of a TTI element. Its value is defined by the order of the tt:p elements. Its value is incremented by 1 for each further processed tt:p element. If the content of a tt:p converted to STL text format takes up more than 112 bytes of space, it has to be mapped to multiple TTI blocks. Each of these resulting TTI blocks has the same SN. For example, if the third tt:p element is currently processed, its SN is set to 2. For the fourth, the SN of all the TTI blocks needed to represent this tt:p is set to 3 and so on.

requirement.title: Extension Block Number mapping
requirement.description: If the currently processed tt:p element's content is short enough to fit in a single TTI-block, meaning its content converted to STL text format doesn't take up more than 112 bytes of space, the Extension Block Number (EBN) is set to 255 (FFh). Otherwise the tt:p element is split and the EBN of each resulting TTI-block is mapped according to EBU Tech 3264 (p.11).

requirement.title: Offset parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "offset", that describes if an offset shall be used for the time codes or not. The value of the parameter is either "0" if no offset shall be used, or the value of the desired offset in seconds.

requirement.title: Time Code In mapping
requirement.description: The TCI element is a child of the TTI element. Its value is the respective tt:p element's begin attribute's value converted into a smpte timecode taken into account the specified framerate from the DSC field with the format hhmmssff (hh = hours, mm = minutes, ss = seconds, ff = frames). If an offset in seconds is given by a parameter, this offset is added. If the value of the begin attribute does not conform to the expected time code format (taking into account the specified framerate) the transformation exits with an error message.

requirement.title: Time Code Out mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code Out (TCO) is a child of a TTI element. Its value is the respective tt:p element's end attribute's value converted into a smpte timecode with the format hhmmssff (hh = hours, mm = minutes, ss = seconds, ff = frames). If an offset in seconds is given by a parameter, this offset is added. If the value of the end attribute does not conform to the expected time code format (taking into account the specified framerate) the transformation exits with an error message.

requirement.title: JC parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "JC", that defines the Justification Code used for each TTI block in the resulting STL XML file.

requirement.title: Justification Code mapping
requirement.description: The Justification Code (JC) is taken from the tts:textAlign attribute of the currently processed tt:p element. If the space attribute of the next ancestor is set to "preserve", the JC is set to 00 hex. Otherwise the mapping is done according to EBU Tech 3264 (p.13). If no tts:textAlign attribute value is applicable, the fall back value 02 hex (centred text) is used.

requirement.title: Comment Flag mapping
requirement.description: The Comment Flag (CF) is set to 1 if there exists an ebuttExt:comment element that's a child of a tt:metadata element which is the first child of the currently processed tt:p element and this comment hasn't been mapped yet to another TTI Block. Otherwise its value is set to 0. If the content of this ebuttExt:comment element converted to STL text format takes up more than 112 bytes of space, it has to be mapped to multiple TTI blocks and the CF of all resulting TTI blocks containing this data is set to 1 as well.

requirement.title: Comment mapping
requirement.description: If there exists an ebuttExt:comment elements that's a child of a tt:metadata element which is the first child of the currently processed tt:p element, the content of this ebuttExt:comment element is mapped into in the Text field (TF) element of the TTI block whose Comment Flag (CF) was set to 1. If the content of this ebuttExt:comment element converted to STL text format takes up more than 112 bytes of space, it has to be mapped to multiple TTI blocks.

requirement.title: STL XML validation
requirement.description: The resulting STL XML file has to be valid against the respective STL XML XSD.

requirement.title: DoubleHeight parameter
requirement.description: There is a parameter, e.g. called "doubleHeight", that can have three different values. Allowed values are "single", "double" or "default". If the parameter is set to "single", all subtitles in the processed EBU-TT file are interpreted as having singleHeight. If the parameter is set to "double", all subtitles in the processed EBU-TT file are interpreted as having doubleHeight. If the parameter is set to "default", the height for each TTI block is calculated if possible. In order to calculate if doubleHeight is used or not, the height of the text in relation to the height of the video is taken as reference for the calculation.

requirement.title: DoubleHeight parameter handling
requirement.description: If the "doubleHeight" parameter is set to "double", the first element in each row represented in the TF element is a DoubleHeight element.

requirement.title: DSC parameter handling
requirement.description: If the "DSC" parameter is set to 1 or 2, only the control codes applicable for teletext subtitles are used according to EBU Tech 3264 (p.14).

requirement.title: Newline elements
requirement.description: If the "doubleHeight" parameter is set to "double", a tt:br element is realised by two adjacent newline elements.

requirement.title: DoubleHeight in a line
requirement.description: If the "doubleHeight" parameter is set to "double" or it is set to "default" and for the currently created TTI block doubleHeight is calculated, the first element in a line (whereby a line break equals to two adjacent newline elements) is a DoubleHeight element.

requirement.title: tt:span element mapping
requirement.description: If a tt:span element references a style with one ore more properties that do not apply through styles that were inherited, the differences between the inherited style properties and the new style properties are matched with the appropriate Control Codes according to EBU Tech 3264 Appendix 2 (p.24). If for example the current style references a black background with white foreground and the new style references a black background with a yellow foreground, only the Control Codes for changing the foreground are applied.

requirement.title: StartBox and EndBox placement
requirement.description: Every line of text represented in a TF field is started by two StartBox and ended by two EndBox elements. The only element that comes before two StartBox elements in a line is the doubleHeight element if the usage of doubleHeight was either calculated or given by the doubleHeight parameter.

requirement.title: tt:br to newline mapping
requirement.description: If the "doubleHeight" parameter is set to "double", a tt:br element within a tt:p element is mapped with two adjacent newline elements. Otherwise it is mapped with one newline element.

requirement.title: Control Code interpretation
requirement.description: In a Text Field (TF) the Control Codes between words act as spaces according to EBU Tech 3360 (p.41). The number of spaces in the TF element is equivalent to the number of spaces in the tt:p element if the spaces are intended to be preserved. Otherwise there's one space between two words. For example if the mapping of two words with a space between them would result in the two words with a space element and a Control Code between them, the space will be ignored.

requirement.title: Supported colour mapping
requirement.description: All colours used in an EBU-TT file are mapped to the colours supported in EBU STL according to EBU Tech 3264 Appendix 2 (p.24).

requirement.title: Supported styles mapping
requirement.description: All color values of tts:color and tts:backgroundColor in an EBU-TT file are mapped to the colours supported in EBU STL according to EBU Tech 3264 Appendix 2 (p.24).

requirement.title: Style mapping
requirement.description: If the EBU-TT file was created by transforming an STL XML file, a tt:span element referencing a new style is mapped as follows: First the difference to the currently applied style is identified. If the styles differ in the used background, the colour referenced for the background is identified. If the styles differ in the used foreground, the colour used for the text is identified. In both of these cases the colours are appropriate representations for the colours given in the table at EBU Tech 3360 4.4.7.1 (p.41). To map the tt:span element with the new background, the element representing the appropriate background colour's Control Code is given. Then a NewBackground element is set. To map the tt:span element with the new foreground, the element representing the appropriate text colour's Control is given. For example, a style referencing green text on yellow background that differs in both background and foreground from the previously referenced style (f.e. named "GreenOnYellow") is mapped by <AlphaYellow><NewBackground><AlphaGreen>.

requirement.title: Not supported character handling
requirement.description: All characters not supported by the specified character code table for the tti block are ignored (see EBU Tech 3264 Appendix 2 for the characters supported by the different character code tables).

requirement.title: Referenced Code Page mapping
requirement.description: All characters supported by the referenced Code Page are used correctly according to EBU Tech 3264 Appendix 2.

requirement.title: Element locations - GSI Header
requirement.description: The order of the GSI element's children in the STL XML file is the same described in EBU Tech 3264 Table 1 (p.4).

requirement.title: Element locations - TTI block
requirement.description: The order of a TTI element's children in the STL XML file is the same described in EBU Tech 3264 Table 2 (p.10).

requirement.title: STL XML validation
requirement.description: The generated STL XML validates against the given STL XML XSD under the assumption that the source STL file conforms to the Specification EBU Tech 3264.

requirement.title: Code Page 850 validation
requirement.description: If the character code table number in the GSI header is 850 it can be validated that all representations of the GSI header fields in the STL XML contain only Unicode characters that are mappings of the characters in the Code page 850 (Multilingual) table (page 16).

requirement.title: Code Page 850 - GSI Header (20h - 7Fh)
requirement.description: The STL to STLXML module supports the Code Page 850 for the GSI Header block. Only the chars 0x20 to 0xFF (except 0x7F) are considered, as the other chars are usually treated as control chars.

requirement.title: Character Code table 00 - TTI blocks - Code Range 20h-7Eh
requirement.description: The STL to STLXML module supports the character code table 00 (ISO 6937/2) for the TTI Blocks in the code range 20h - 7Eh.

requirement.title: Character Code table 00 - TTI blocks (A0h - FFh)
requirement.description: The STL to STLXML module supports the character code table 00 (ISO 6937/2) for the TTI Blocks in the code range A0h - FFh.

requirement.title: Decoding Code Page dependent
requirement.description: The values of the GSI element's children are decoded depending on the used Code Page that's given in the CPN-field of the GSI Header as described in EBU Tech 3264 Table 1 (p.4).

requirement.title: Code Page Number mapping
requirement.description: The Code Page Number (CPN) field in the STL file (Bytes 0 to 2) is mapped to the CPN element.

requirement.title: Disk Format Code mapping
requirement.description: The Disk Format Code (DFC) field in the STL file (Bytes 3 to 10) is mapped to the DFC element.

requirement.title: Display Standard Code mapping
requirement.description: The Display Standard Code (DSC) field in the STL file (Byte 11) is mapped to the DSC element. The Display Standard Code "Blank" for the value "Undefined" is translated as a space (20h).

requirement.title: Character Code Table Number mapping
requirement.description: The Character Code Table Number (CCT) field in the STL file (Bytes 12 to 13) is mapped to the CCT element. If the character code in the STL is not defined by Tech 3264 the conversion is stopped.

requirement.title: Language Code mapping
requirement.description: The Language Code (LC) field in the STL file (Bytes 14 to 15) is mapped to the LC element.

requirement.title: Original Programme Title (OPT), Bytes 16 to 47, OPT
requirement.description: The Original Programme Title (OPT) field in the STL file (Bytes 16 to 47) is mapped to OPT element.

requirement.title: Original Episode Title mapping
requirement.description: The Original Episode Title (OET) field in the STL file (Bytes 48 to 79) is mapped to the OET element.

requirement.title: Translated Programme Title mapping
requirement.description: The Translated Programme Title (TPT) field in the STL file (Bytes 80 to 111) is mapped to the TPT element.

requirement.title: Translated Episode Title mapping
requirement.description: The Translated Episode Title (TET) field in the STL file (Bytes 112 to 143) is mapped to the TET element.

requirement.title: Translator's Name mapping
requirement.description: The Translator's Name (TN) field in the STL file (Bytes 144 to 175) is mapped to the TN element.

requirement.title: Translator's Contact Details mapping
requirement.description: The Translator's Contact Details (TCD) field in the STL file (Bytes 176 to 207) is mapped to the TCD element.

requirement.title: Subtitle List Reference Code mapping
requirement.description: The Subtitle List Reference Code (SLR) field in the STL file (Bytes 208 to 223) is mapped to the SLR element.

requirement.title: Creation Date mapping
requirement.description: The Creation Date (CD) field in the STL file (Bytes 224 to 229) is mapped to the CD element.

requirement.title: Revision Date mapping
requirement.description: The Revision Date (RD) field in the STL file (Bytes 230 to 235) is mapped to the RD element.

requirement.title: Revision Number mapping
requirement.description: The Revision Number (RN) field in the STL file (Bytes 236 to 237) is mapped to the element RN.

requirement.title: Total Number of Text and Timing Information blocks mapping
requirement.description: The Total Number of Text and Timing Information (TNB) field in the STL file (Bytes 238 to 242) is mapped to the TNB element.

requirement.title: Total Number of Subtitles mapping

requirement.title: Total Number of Subtitle Groups mapping

requirement.title: Publisher mapping

requirement.title: Editor's Name mapping

requirement.title: Editor's Contact Details mapping

requirement.title: User-Defined Area mapping

requirement.title: Subtitle Group Number mapping

requirement.title: Subtitle Number mapping

requirement.title: Extension Block Number mapping
requirement.description: The Extension Block Number (EBN) field in the STL file (Byte 3) is mapped to the EBN element. The TF field of a TTI Blocks that has a EBN number in the Range 00-EF is concatenated with following one until a TTI Block has an EBN with the value FF (except an optional parameter disables the concatenation). TTI Blocks with the value FE (User Data) are output with the Text Field (TF) content converted to Base64. TTI Blocks with an EBN in the range F0-FD (Reserved Codes) are ignored.

requirement.title: Cumulative Status mapping
requirement.description: The Cumulative Status (CS) field in the STL file (Byte 4) is mapped to the CS element.

requirement.title: Time Code In mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code In (TCI) field in the STL file (Bytes 5 to 8) is mapped to the TCI element. The hex values are encoded as decimal.

requirement.title: Time Code Out mapping
requirement.description: The Time Code Out (TCO) field in the STL file (Bytes 9 to 12) is mapped to the TCO element. Hex values are encoded as decimals.

requirement.title: Vertical Position mapping
requirement.description: The Vertical Position (VP) field in the STL file (Byte 13) is mapped to the VP element.

requirement.title: Justification Code mapping

requirement.title: Comment Flag mapping
requirement.description: The Comment Flag (CF) field in the STL file (Byte 15) is mapped to the CF element.

requirement.title: Text Field mapping
requirement.description: The Text Field (TF) field in the STL file (Bytes 16 to 127) is mapped to the TF element. If the respective TTI block contains User Data (EBN value 0xFE), the content is converted to Base64.

requirement.title: Space mapping

requirement.title: Text Field mapping - Text
